poem:
Title: Amidst Stone, Steel and Scripture

In the classroom, the battleground,
we teach not arithmetic, but Allegiances 
Burning prayer and binders, mid conflict.
10 secretaries - 14 years,
a carousel of values spun.
The child's slate remains, unimpressed,
by the stir of dusty doctrine.
Religion's row in cold community,
not in the light of reason does the lesson lie,
but in the quiet moments. Transcending textbook, transcending prayer.
